Reviews.Title: Sound quality is laughable.
Reviews.Author: J. Burley
Reviews.Content: THE TV.I completely agree with the review left by Steve P. Moss. I love the picture. Very sharp and vibrant. I haven't given it a 1080p test but I'm not sure how important it is on a 24". I love the thinness and the overall look of the set. along with a digital out it has an analog out (red and white) which I guess is hard to come by these days.THE SOUND.I thought something was wrong when I first turned it on. It seems that the new and thinner sets are going lack quality. I guess there isn't room to add quality speakers (so they say). And no headphone jack is a bummer. Seems like a bedroom TV so why not add it. I'm still going to give this TV a shot but if I can't fix the sound, I'll return it also. If you want to read my current audio fix read below.MOUNTING.I also purchased a Cheetah mount and there was another issue there. The corner of the plate that attaches to the TV covered up both HDMI ports. If you decide to mount it, you may want to look at the smaller version or another brand.SOUND FIX.I am still trying to work out this sound situation after a week of internet searching. I have a pair of cheap Altec Lansing PC speakers that I purchased and are powered by the TV's USB and using a Y adapter from the RCA jacks to the 3.5mm. Unfortunate issue is the TV cannot control the volume. I need to adjust it by the speaker's volume. This may be fine for movies, but for regular TV watching may be a pain with channel surfing and loud commercials. If the TV had a headphone jack this would not be an issue.UPDATE: Sent this TV back and picked up the Toshiba 26C100U. After I set it up and turned up the volume, all I could say was "Finally. I can hear it". Without jumping through hoops.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding picture but sound is awful
Reviews.Author: Steve P. Moss
Reviews.Content: The 24" screen is perfect for our kitchen and the picture is truly spectacular. However the sound is just terrible. There is no distortion through the volume range, but the sound is incredibly tinny and phone-like. I am being totally serious in saying my bedside clock AM radio sounds better than this TV. That is what I don't get with the sub-29" TV market. They will mostly be used in locations where there is no room or need for a home theater system, and yet clearly the audio is an afterthought.So ok, I can maybe find space to install a PC speaker system to make the TV listenable, but it only has line-out audio jacks, so the TV remote will not control the volume, and there is no headphone jack.This is such a glaring problem on small TVs, that I am amazed, or more accurately, annoyed it has not been addressed. I will have to return this TV.Have you noticed it is impossible to evaluate the sound of a TV in a store where they have 100 TVs on and all tuned to the same channel?UPDATE:  Returned the Toshiba after one week. I just could not get used to the audio. I got the 26" LG LED LCD. Sooo much better audio, and with a headphone jack in case I do want to upgrade the sound, but don't think I will need to. It cost an extra $100 over the 24" Toshiba, but the only add-on powered speaker system I could find with a wireless remote was the ZVOX Mini for $199. Made no sense.

Reviews.Title: Stunning picture ....deplorable sound options
Reviews.Author: Athena
Reviews.Content: I bought this television for my parents' bedroom.  The picture is incredibly beautiful and they both loved it instantly.  One has significant hearing loss though so I was planning to add a set of computer speakers to improve the volume and quality of the sound.  Unfortunately, that's not possible on this TV because it doesn't have a headphone jack.  I even bought a Y-cable to connect the RCA out jacks on the TV to the speakers; only to discover that the audio out has no volume control.The salesrep at the store from which I bought the TV wanted to sell me a sound bar.  When I asked her if she was seriously expecting customers to pay more than the price of the TV to get decent sound, she suggested that my parents could use wireless headphones all the time.  I also called Toshiba about the lack of volume control and the rep there said the expectation was that customers would be using a surround sound system with its own remote control...for a 24" TV.I really think that Toshiba missed the boat here.  Buying an LED panel doesn't mean someone will automatically be inclined to spend a lot of money on add-ons.  And as we've seen, even if you are willing to spend something extra, nothing exists because a) without a headphone jack, the TV won't control the volume for external speakers and b) *all* the short (i.e. 20" or less) speaker bars made are in fact PC speakers.  Toshiba could have made a major splash in the small screen market with this panel if someone had actually thought about about the sound issue.  If the cost of an extra headphone jack was too much, a simple software option to control the audio-out volume would have made a huge difference.UPDATE: I took it back and got an RCA at Sears.  It also has an LED panel and includes a headphone jack.  So now we have a very good picture and have added some inexpensive computer speakers for much improved sound.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann
Reviews.Content: I got a great price by buying an "open box" but now I see why it was returned.  I read the reviews about the bad sound but thought I wasn't that picky and it was just going to serve as a small TV for the bedroom.  The sound is worse than bad--it's almost annoying.  After realizing I was just turning it off to eliminate the noise, I decided to return it too.

Reviews.Title: Adjust The Sound
Reviews.Author: Abraham
Reviews.Content: The sound on this tv seems to be the issue with all the reviews. Did anyone know that there is a bass, trebble, and balance adjustment.  After I adjusted these the sound is fine.  The picture I agree with all, is excellent.  I don't know why but so many tv's do not come with headphone jacks anymore.  Like some one said for a tv that is a size most people use in the bedroom, headphone jacks would be a good idea. But let me say that a little adjustment of the bass and trebble and the sound is what I would expect from a tv in this range.

Reviews.Title: Skip this one!
Reviews.Author: J. Grandbois
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV at a big box store, despite the poor reviews we read regarding the sound of the speakers. The salesman insisted that it would sound just fine in our average size, quiet bedroom.  BIG MISTAKE!  Are you old enough to remember transistor radios?  Cause that is the sound quality that this TV's speakers produce.  We were replacing our old 19" box-type TV that had great sound so the difference was really noticeable.  We even tried to tweek it by raising up the bass and lowering the treble but it still sounds hollow.  There are much better TV's on the market to buy.

Reviews.Title: I wasn't listening....
Reviews.Author: Lisa;P "Lisa;P"
Reviews.Content: I already had a larger Toshiba TV and liked it. So when I needed a new TV for my kitchen, I was happy to get another. The 24 inch was the perfect size.Didn't take long to set up, nice looking, sharp picture. My only complaint is that the sound quality was very tinny. Thought maybe it was because of where I placed the TV. Went back to store looking for speakers, salesman (who sold me the TV) laughed. He said alot of people complained about the sound and I needed to buy an amplifier to go along with the speakers.Plus, if I did that, I would need to control the volume thru the amp not the TV remote. If the salesman would have mentioned a sound problem, I might have spent a bit more money for a better TV!!!!Because it's for the kitchen, it's serving it's purpose and not worth the effort to return.I set the audio bass on high and the treble on low,it's a bit better but still not the quality to where it should be. I have learned a lesson for my next set,will listen as well as look at the picture, and hopefully by then Toshiba will have learned a lesson too!!!

Reviews.Title: Lots of problems, and no help available!
Reviews.Author: La Coccinelle
Reviews.Content: While the picture itself is pretty good, the TV has a number of problems.The first is the sound.  It's just plain awful.  Cheap computer speakers would be better... though since there's no headphone jack, that's not really an easy option.  We managed to attach a pair of old (but decent) speakers to the TV through one of the audio outputs, but the TV speakers continue to work as well, so you still have to hear the tinniness on top of the halfway-decent sound from the external speakers.The second problem is the picture.  While the TV can detect DVDs and automatically switch to an appropriate fullscreen mode, it does not do the same with television signals.  Setting the picture to anything other than "4:3" results in distortion... and "4:3" is no good either because it cuts off a lot of vertical space on either side of the picture (which is very noticeable when the actors are not centered in the frame; the widescreen programs become obvious).  We've played with all the picture settings and called tech support twice... but it seems that the only choices are a stretched picture or a cut-off one.  Why the TV can't detect whether a TV signal is widescreen or not (while it can do so with DVDs) is beyond me.The third problem (and it's kind of a major one) is that the TV has no manual.  It comes with what is essentially a "quick start guide", but it doesn't have any information about the TV's more advanced features.  And when I went to the website to find the manual, I got a message informing me that there was no manual for that product!  No manual, no helpful advice from tech support...  I realize this is an inexpensive TV, but is it too much to ask to be able to, you know, watch television on it?

Reviews.Title: Sound just gets worse.
Reviews.Author: Jeff Chandler
Reviews.Content: Picture was surprisingly good.  I have a special program to bring the tv to studio specs.  This tv required very little adjustment.It was cheap, but the more I listen to it, the more I wished I had sent it back.  I attached some ancillary powered speakers, but they are cumbersome.  I cannot hear this TV. It is so bad. It's like missing a whole range of bass that is necessary for discerning words.

Reviews.Title: Frankenstein would say: Picture GOOD!  Sound BAD!
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the picture quality of this set is very good, but the speaker quality is absolutely horrendous. The only solution is to add some form of external amplification and speakers or perform a warranty voiding modification to the set.Now this being a 24" set, I don't really envision this set as being the center piece of a home theater setup, but apparently Toshiba does with their pitiful built in speakers. Okay, so the speakers suck, why not just plug in a set of cheap computer speakers? Well, you could but the only audio outputs on this set are two fixed line level rca jacks-not variable. This means the volume of any external speakers cannot be controlled by the tv. Okay, so maybe like me you have an extra amplifier and speakers around that you can hook up. This works, but I found (at least on the one I got) the line level jacks on the tv produce a noticeable background hum. Not as noticeable when listening to programs, but once you know it's there it is kind of hard to not be aware of it.The manufacturer of this set really dropped the ball with the speaker design. While this is just a 24" set and there is no expectation of spectacular sound, this set is so below par in this area that it is hard to believe that what I previously believed to be a top tier home electronics manufacturer would let this product go out the door. It makes no sense for them as anyone who buys this set will be totally unhappy with the sound quality. I guarantee that this set will have an extremely high return rate because of its extremely poor sound quality. Most people aren't going to go through the expense and hassle of sound add ons and will simply return the set. I understand that manufacturers are in a squeeze to cut costs,but products still need to provide a level of performance that is reasonable. I would only recommend this set to people who are deaf.

Reviews.Title: Nice low power TV but with a couple of gotchas.
Reviews.Author: C. Olson
Reviews.Content: I bought this little ten pound TV for the bedroom to wake up to, using an external timer. Fortunately it remembers the stations and most settings when turned on after having main power cut off by the timer. Power demand is 35 watts. The picture is very nice when viewed with center at eye level, but lying down in bed and viewing the screen from various points below the surface it's standing on, you find the picture gets darker, with blacks behaving very oddly. The natural step to avoid this is to tilt the top of the screen forward, but the mounting base only permits tilting it backward - - no doubt for safety reasons. I found I needed a one inch thick bar of wood under the rear edge of the stand to keep the picture from darkening too badly, watching from my bed, but then if you decide to stand, viewing it from way above, the picture gets very light and bleached out. I added wires to hooks in the wall to keep the tilted screen from falling on me during an earthquake.Sound quality is indeed poor with very limited low frequency response due to the narrow oblong speakers required to fit in the cabinet. But stereo right/left RCA connectors and optical audio are provided for an external amp with larger speakers.A 60 page User's Manual can be downloaded, and it helps a lot with navigating the menu system and getting the most out of this product.

Reviews.Title: Purchased as laptop and video monitor
Reviews.Author: stvbck
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Toshiba 24SL410U to use as an external monitor for my laptop, a display for DSS/DVD/VCR, and as a future monitor for a planned new computer.My laptop has VGA out (ATI Mobility Radeon Express 200) and my video outputs are either component or composite.At first, the picture was very poor. Ridiculously over saturated color, much too bright. The picture on my old CRT TV was much better. It took hours (I almost gave up) of playing with the TV settings, video card settings, and DVD settings to finally get an acceptable picture. A lot of variables. I'm now satisfied with the image from the computer, and the image from video is equivalent to the CRT TV. Contrast, backlight, and brightness had to be turned way down, and individual hue, saturation, and brightness under "base color adjustment" had to be turned down for the computer.The sound is weak, but I did not intend to use the internal speakers anyway.I realize I'm using a HD device with SD inputs, but was surprised to find that a SD picture on a CRT is just as good if not better than a LCD TV. I'm hoping to be much more impressed with a HDMI signal from a future new computer or video source.In conclusion, plan on spending a lot of time with adjustments to gain satisfaction from VGA or SD inputs.

Reviews.Title: Quality, Reliability, Advanced technology LED TV with Awesome Sound.
Reviews.Author: K MavAZ
Reviews.Content: People, the sound problem is not as complicated as many reviewers here have construed into an unfathomable product defect with no option other than to return the TV. If one looks at the picture of the TV with a diagram next to it in the description above, a small device called "Digital Audio Out" is present. Not one mention of this in any review. Check out Wally World's website and you will find this product:Sony SA-32SE1 All-In-One SoundBarModel#: SA-32SE1Supplied remote controlOnline$78.00The sound from this SONY soundBar is amazing! Complete with sub-woofer adjustability it offers a dimension of surround sound to an otherwise low quality sound that is inherent in most TVs in this class. As stated it comes complete with a REMOTE CONTROL. Now one must decide if they want an amazing picture from a highly reliable company utilizing top of the line technology for a low price and for $78 more adding incredible sound to formulate a perfect combination or not.

Reviews.Title: TV Defective - HORRIBLE!!! customer service
Reviews.Author: Jim Trotz
Reviews.Content: Wife bought TV on Amazon for Xmas. Turned it on for 1st time yesterday and it worked fine for about 30 minutes. It then started a cycle of screen going blank (including the power led), a flash, then the screen shows the INPUT name (i.e. HDMI 1) and it works again. The cycle then started repeating more often, to the point that its constant and nothing is displayed!I contacted Toshiba (document in the box that says don't return to store). After being on hold for 45 minutes and being handed off to 3 different groups (having to repeat the whole story, and regurgitate the serial number, model number, and case number each time) they finally agreed to have ME PAY to ship it to a depot - god knows when I would see it again! But, before they could tell me the RMA info I was cut off, probably due to their poor phone connection to India!This happened a total of 4 times! (I was desperate to get this resolved), each time I was on hold 20 minutes waiting to reach a human!Finally, I was able to get to the point of getting the RMA info and was then told that if I called back tomorrow and begged really nicely I MIGHT be able to convince them to wave the shipping charges to repair (not replace) a TV that I have in service for less than hour!I will NEVER buy a Toshiba TV if I have to deal with these jerks again!!PS: AMAZON processed the TV return in less than 5 minutes and printed the UPS label for me ....

Reviews.Title: Mistake
Reviews.Author: Andrew Mel
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in a local store under the assumption that it seemed competitively priced and I was familiar with the brand. Big mistake. While the setup and picture quality were great the sound was TERRIBLE. Returned it immediately.

Reviews.Title: Sound improvement for $10.00!
Reviews.Author: MossRose
Reviews.Content: The picture on this hdtv is gorgeous, but the sound is horrible: tinny and annoying.  I considered returning the tv and replacing it with one that includes a headphone jack.  After researching expensive solutions like sound bars that are move expensive -- and larger--than the tv and failing to locate any pc speakers that don't require a headphone jack, which this tv does not have, I found that my old Altec ipod speaker plus a $9.99 stereo mini to RCA "Y" cable met my needs.  The sound is terrific.  Yes, I do have to turn the sound on and off manually, but with the fantastic Toshiba picture and the low price of the tv I'm very happy with my bargain.

Reviews.Title: Built in netbook speakers are better than this TV
Reviews.Author: G. Rodgers
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews about the poor quality speakers of this TV. I am not picky so I bought this TV anyway from Best Buy, I had planned to use an external speaker system. I set it up this evening, turned it on and was VERY disappointed.Not only are the speakers terrible (they make me want to vomit) The unit I bought has back-light bleeding, poor viewing angles and just an overall cloudy look. I have never seen such an ugly LCD or LED screen.  I can't wait to return this in the morning.

Reviews.Title: Its really not that bad
Reviews.Author: Ryan Goldie
Reviews.Content: This tv is perfectly fine for a small space like a small apartment or dorm room, the price cannot be beat! This tv is perfect for me, a deployed soldier looking for a better tv than they sell at the Post Exchange (ripoff artists).

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Gamer
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for Christmas. It was perfect for my gaming needs, with it's gaming mode. I am EXTREMELY pleased with the picture quality it is amazing. I use headphones (TurtleBeach X31s) and the audio is fine. The external sound is fine if you turn treble almost all the way down and bass all the way up. I would recommend external speakers, though. I would give this TV a 4 1/2 star rating if I could ; but for everything besides the slight abnormality with the external sound, it is about the best 24 inch TV you could buy.

Reviews.Title: Stunning TV
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: I got this HDTV to replace my 19" (Orion) box TV, which could can only display 480i resolution. I use my new (Toshiba) HDTV for the (PS3), and the picture quality is just flawless! This HDTV displays 1080p Resolution! The sound quality is awesome as well! The TV only weights 10 pounds. The buttons on the TV itself are NOT physical buttons, they're heat sensitive touch buttons.Make sure you get the HD set up, which is usually done with an HDMI Cable, Which are about $20 online, but there are other methods to get HD also, but I just went ahead and got the HDMI Cable, and it is fantastic!(Toshiba) makes very durable and very high quality stuff. This HDTV is worth every penny! This HDTV gets a 5/5 score, and a 10/10 score from me!

Reviews.Title: Exelent Tv , Good Picture and Good Sound¡¡
Reviews.Author: daviderb74
Reviews.Content: I read all bad comments here regarding the bad sound of this TV , but the Good Picture Quality, and because i bought this for gaming and use Wireless Headphones i didn't mind and i bought it.This TV has a very cool Design , Touch Buttons  , 2 HDMI PORTS , all you need , i have a week with this tv and tv has been working good.Regarding the Sound , mine has a very good sound , clear and Loud¡¡ what I Noticed on the back of my tv is that it was Manufactured this Year 2012 , so maybe they fixed the Sound¡ but its all Good¡ so despite Sound Bad Comments¡ and Go Ahead¡

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: alexthelionking
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a month now. I love it! The picture is amazing. The sound isn't as bad as all the other reviews are making it out to be. It sounds just fine to me, and if you want to upgrade you can always buy your own speakers. It's only 24 inches, so I'm assuming if you're checking this tv out it's not going to be for a man cave or anything. For the price and quality it just can't be beat. I know if you are reading this you are probably skeptical but trust me on this. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Speakers
Reviews.Author: SEA
Reviews.Content: The Tv showed up 3 days after I ordered it. Very nice picture quality, only issue is the speakers facing downward. Definitely need external speakers. Extra $50 for a good quality external speaker system. No biggey, considering the price of this Tv.

Reviews.Title: Good for the bedroom
Reviews.Author: Dave "Dave"
Reviews.Content: The picture is perfect. The sound isn't that great but good enough for the bedroom. I've bought this brand because I've always had good results with Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Recommend
Reviews.Author: RickP530
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product to use as a computer monitor and TV. The TV does not sit correctly on it's base. It leans down at a 1 inch angle. The TV also knocked out my computer sound. Called Toshiba for support and they could not help. I sent the TV back. Just the way the TV sits on the base would make a lot of customers unhappy. Amazon was great with refunding me.

Reviews.Title: nicek
Reviews.Author: sandrosuero
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Just like i thought.Real HDVery thin.  Certainly LED.1080 precision image.24 Inch.And the warranty of Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: decent little TV
Reviews.Author: happy
Reviews.Content: Came as promised, easy to set up and program.  Picture is excellant the sound is a little tinny but not obnoxiously so.  I checked a few other 24" LED's out in the store and most of them had a similar problem.  For the price this was an excellant value.  If you want to improve the sound get a sound bar, the TV has plenty of connections to add it in.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, bad sound, frustrating menu
Reviews.Author: Ross H
Reviews.Content: The price and the picture are the only good things this Toshiba TV has to offer.Picture:  The picture is amazing.  Crystal clear and vibrant.  I didn't even need to fuss with any settings!Sound:  The speakers are very bad.  Unlistenable right out of the box.  I changed a couple of settings to make it sound more like AM radio than noise.  After then, I still didn't like it, but I got used to it.Menu:  Most products' menus are acceptable at worst, but this TV's menu was quite frustrating.  All of the options are covered, but the way you must navigate the menus themselves is unnatural.  I should not need to think so hard when using a simple television menu.I will be returning this TV for a 32" 720p Sharp (720p and 1080p look identical at my intended viewing distance of 4+ feet).  The Sharp offers 8 additional inches in screen size and better reviews, all at the low, low price of this Toshiba!Update:I am extremely satisfied with the 32" Sharp.  If you have the extra space, this is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, Blah sound....
Reviews.Author: roharrow
Reviews.Content: We've enjoyed this TV very much for what it was intended for. We mostly watch DVD's and streaming video from a blueray player in one of our kids room. I also move it into the kitchen when frying wings during football games. The LED picture is awesome. The sound is very "tinny" which is to be expected from speakers in a small, thin TV.  The built in tuner works well both over the air with $20 Digital rabbit ears and with open signal standard and HD channels from my cable provider. Pleased so far.

Reviews.Title: Good Pic, Lousy Sound
Reviews.Author: Stormer
Reviews.Content: I bought it because it was lightweight (around 10 lbs) and has a good picture. It's perfect for the bedroom or kitchen.HOWEVER!The sound is thin and tinny. I really do get better sound out of my cellphone's speakerphone speaker than out of this TV.Although you can attach external speakers, there's no control over the amplitude of the Line Out jacks. Since there's no headphone jack, using external speakers requires either you get up to change the volume or buy an expensive speaker set that uses yet another remote.I took the set back and am looking at a different manufacturer.It may be ok for an extra monitor or maybe for a kiosk display unit, but as a stand-alone TV, Toshiba really messed up with this one.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba TV...not too good...
Reviews.Author: Joe Gohlke
Reviews.Content: Agree with the other reviewers about the sound quality, it's really awful.  We've "adjusted" the sound as suggested by turning the bass all the way up and it's still pretty bad.  For the money, there are way better choices out there.Toshiba TV's in general also have some interesting quirks.  The "mute" button requires 2-presses to go on full mute.  The first press reduces the volume by half, the 2nd press is full mute.  Once the TV is fully muted, the Closed Captioning kicks on.  Neither of these "features" can be disabled.  Maybe somebody finds this attractive, but we don't.  We have 3 Toshiba TVs and the CC issue is only a problem for the one TV we have hooked directly to cable (the other 2 go through a box that must filter out the CC).  The double-press for mute is also very annoying, not sure why somebody at Toshiba thought it would be fun to make everybody who presses the mute button, double-tap it.  Since we don't use or want 1/2 mute, we have to press the mute twice to make it work.One more thing...the channel option setup screen (where you select the channels you want to see when surfing and set the other channels to be skipped) is presented where you have to select the channels you want to skip...this is just the opposite of what you would expect and the first time through I selected all the channels I wanted to watch.  Of course surfing through the channels showed exactly the list of channels I didn't want to see and I had to go back through the setup screen and reverse all my selections.I didn't get around to setting the TV up when we first got it, other than to confirm it works and of course, throw away the box....otherwise we'd be taking it back.We bought it for the kitchen, but now I'm thinking we'll replace it and move it to the spare bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Yes, the sound quality is atrocious.
Reviews.Author: Liam Phoenix
Reviews.Content: Look at all those audio outputs on the back though.I have a PC + Line-in and HDMI carrying audio from gaming consoles and a little $3 adapter plugged in to the red/white audio out for 2+1 speakers via the headphone-style jack. That's a $20 pair of 30 watt speakers with a subwoofer plugged in to this thing and it's worlds better than many much more expensive sets, imagine it with an actual audio system rather than some PC speakers.I see no ghosting, the refresh is good enough to play fast-paced action games, and the color accuracy is better than anything anywhere near this price range. No light bleed, no dead pixels, and this is two years in to using it.The only down side, if you're not using the built-in speaker, is that the stand is a little wobbly. Not enough that it will fall over, but enough that if you bang against the entertainment center you can tell it is a bit unsteady. I wouldn't worry about it though, I have little kids, with all the knocks this thing has taken it really speaks to its staying power.

Reviews.Title: Suited my needs perfectly!
Reviews.Author: LuisS
Reviews.Content: I picked this up on clearance for $100 and it has met my expectations.  It's main purpose was as a monitor and it needs no adjustments for that... at least not with my notebook that is equipped with HDMI output.  Plugged it in, set it to PC mode... viola!  For grins, I decided to try Transformers on blu-ray via my laptop... super nice picture!  Netflix was decent.  The sound is pretty bad, especially if you are sitting close.  I feel like my ears may bleed (yeah, yeah, a bit dramatic).  I fiddled with the settings but I don't think it is the quality per say as much as the speaker placement.  For the time being, I set my laptop as the main audio output (has beats audio, enough said!).So, if you want to have a mini-home theatre, you will need good speakers... if you just need a monitor, it's awesome.  If you're sitting far enough, the audio is not a huge deal.

Reviews.Title: Ok for what I want
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Crystal clear picture on HD channels. Sometimes have to adjust the picture size because the recording was a different format. Hooked up external speakers so don't really care about the cheezy built ins.

Reviews.Title: A great TV
Reviews.Author: Robert Grant
Reviews.Content: This television has a beautiful picture.  The sound, although nothing great, is certainly tolerable.  However, if you really want to enjoy this television you should take advantage of the audio out left and right plugs.  Just plug these into a cheap stereo as audio inputs and you will have fantastic sound combined with a great picture.  I have had years of enjoyment with this television combined with the sound from a cheap stereo receiver.  Look at the back of the television where the red and white audio output plugs are located.  Channel this sound through a stereo and you will enjoy this television much more.  It is easy to do and will make watching movies much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: musamalik
Reviews.Content: put the tv in a shelf in the room . the stand is unstable and always leaning forward then finally broke .bad sound and the tv stand broke while trying to put it in place.

Reviews.Title: Just terrible.
Reviews.Author: Paul T. Klimek
Reviews.Content: Returned after the first day. The audio is hideous. Good picture bad audio. Replaced with a Vizio and am very happy.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 24" Television
Reviews.Author: chucker63
Reviews.Content: a great t.v. very good picture and soundworks really well,best thing I ever ordered,no problems at all love all the features,Ihighly reccomend it...

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Jomy
Reviews.Content: The picture is truly beautiful the sound isn't good but i have Turtle Beaches hooked up to it so its not a problem for me it makes for a nice computer monitor

Reviews.Title: well worth the price
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: Bought this T V for our spare bedroom. The picture is excellent,and the sound has so many setting that you can make it sound great too, unlike other people who left comments, for this price and 1080 you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Sharon E. Cutler
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we puchased this tv and on the advice of the previous reviewers adjusted the settings.  Great picture and audio - great value price.  Thank you Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great price.
Reviews.Author: Graham
Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV after receiving an email from Amazon.com.  Opted for the overnight shipping which with my Prime membership was just $3.99.  I placed the order at 10am and received it from UPS at 1pm the next day.  The TV is clear, sharp and the receiver is super sensitive.  Auto program detected 49 stations in South Central Florida using only an RV antenna on my Fifth Wheel trailer.I am very satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great picture even with coax cable hook-up
Reviews.Author: Larry Schoncite
Reviews.Content: Another great purchase from Amazon...We have 2 other Toshiba TV's and needed one to replace an old 15". Glad I chose Toshiba. Assembly was a cinch, and up and running in 8 minutes. TV is connected to a wall with coax cable, no HDMI and the picture is great. Wife watches USA and TNT alot and the picture  seems like Hi Def. This TV sits close to a Toshiba all-in-one computer, so I guess we like Toshiba products. Would I reccommend this TV to a friend: Definately!Larry S.  Palm Desert, CA

Reviews.Title: Flat screen
Reviews.Author: j r
Reviews.Content: A nice TV for the price the picture quality is very good, but the sound leaves a lot to be desired.  I have to raise the volume to almost full in order to hear it.  I am thinking of putting external speakers.

Reviews.Title: either sound was fixed by toshiba or these amazon reviewers are nutz
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Between 1-2 weeks worth of use. Set in a 230 sq ft room (as it should be - it is 24", not 60", and these yoyos that are expecting break-thru sound on a 24" box are in need of a judgment recalibration).Picture: 9.5/10SOUND: 9/10 (again - it isn't designed for being the showpiece of a living room with 7-person sectional, coffee table and area rug. It's purpose is to amplify sound from a television projecting images at 24" -- the kind you would see on the restroom wall of a sports bar or set in your garage or home office. It does fine for these applications -- no peripheral sound bar or laptop speaker necessary)Presentation: 9/10 - The stand is not the nicest but is certainly functional, and again, for a $190 television at 24", is EXACTLY what is to be expected (much like the speakers). Remote is above-average for this class IMHO.I'd buy another one if I could find somebody at Amazon to sell it to me at the $189.99 I paid a couple weeks ago. Owning it now and knowing what it presents/provides, I'd even pay the $230 it is being sold for currently if I needed another.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - Atrocious Sound Quality!
Reviews.Author: Levi A. Greenfield "Levi"
Reviews.Content: This TV has just an unacceptable audio quality. They are worse than most laptop speakers. Listening to this TV, reminded me of watching a youtube video of a recorded TV. It is difficult to understand voices when multiple people talk at the same time (like a political panel).  I found myself having to watch conversations and concentrate on lip movements to follow everything.This was my only Toshiba purchase, and based on this alone I would not recommend them at all. However their other TVs may be quality products. This one is just very sub-par quality compared to other TVs in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: BIG DISAPPOINTMENT
Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: This was the worse sounding TV I have ever heard.  The sound literally sounded like it was coming from a tin can.  I have returned this product and will not purchase a Toshiba again.

Reviews.Title: Bad, bad purchase.
Reviews.Author: James Ray
Reviews.Content: I guess I should have done some research before I bought this TV from Office Max for $160, but it seemed like such a bargain, that I had to run right out and get it.  Yes, the sound is the worst I have ever heard from a TV set.  I am somewhat hearing impaired, but the sound, even at the lowest volume, hurts my ears because it is so tinny. I would take it back to Office Max, but they charge a 15% restocking fee, which I didn't know about.  After reading the rest of the reviews about this TV, I conclude there is no inexpensive solution to the sound problem.  Shame on Toshiba for ever allowing this TV to come onto the market.  I have a Toshiba laptop, but I will never buy another Toshiba product.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Racine
Reviews.Content: The sound is so terrible that this TV is not worth using for anything - unless you always watch it with the sound muted. Otherwise it really is GARBAGE and you will toss it asap (not worth giving to anyone, unless you really, really don 't like them.

Reviews.Title: Awful Sound Quality
Reviews.Author: David M Lane
Reviews.Content: I couldn't tell in the store how tinny this set sounded.  It sounds like a handheld resistor radio - I'm not kidding.  I lived with it for 2 days and just hauled it back.  It's a shame, because I really liked everything else about it.

Reviews.Title: Sound is awful.  Not worth the low price.
Reviews.Author: Jana Taylor
Reviews.Content: We bought this for around 200 thinking it was a great deal for a bedroom TV, it was slim and looked sharp... a good brand name... had all the right ports and features.  But when we turned it on the sound was so one dimensional and tinny it was as if it was a toy TV.  We immediately returned it to the retailer we got this from for a refund.  We instead went for the 26" Visio Razor which was a little more and a little bigger but had all features and great sound also.This is just not worth the low price.  I'd recommend Visio all our TV's of that brand have great sound.

Reviews.Title: Great TV (sound really not bad at all)
Reviews.Author: Donald S. Kirk
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV today, and must admit I was skeptical after reading the reviews about poor audio.  My wife and I are very pleased with this TV (audio is fine for a TV this size), and this TV has some very nice features for the price (1080p, lots of inputs and outputs, LED back lighting).Sure glad I gave this TV a chance

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: martineperard
Reviews.Content: THIS ITEM WORK PERFECTLY FIND BUT WITH 3 YEAR OF USING IT IT STARTED TO GIVE ME PROBLEM BUT IT IS A GOOD PRODUCT

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!!
Reviews.Author: shugMEM
Reviews.Content: Great Color!! Better than I than thought it would be. Sound is good also, not only  good for bedroom. VERY HAPPY!!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 24Sl410U 24-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED-LCD TV, Black (2011 Model
Reviews.Author: phyllis hitchcock
Reviews.Content: The Toshiba I received works very WELL as a TV or Computer Monitor.It was a little hard to learn the Remote.The shipping time was too long.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price!
Reviews.Author: James Cunningham
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for some time now, and I really enjoy it. Colours are all much nicer on an LED display like this than a regular LCD screen. The sound quality is nothing really, but it's not like anyone promised it would be amazing. It's a flatscreen for Christ sake. It's gonna be crap. But it's definitely usable, and I'm sure most people with be just happy with it, but there is also options for outputting the audio to speakers of your choosing. Interesting note: when you have the audio out plugged in, the sound will not be muted through the TV speakers, these are all controlled independently. It would always be nice to have another set of ports, like another component video.The biggest issue I have with the TV is that it doesn't have a USB port, which means you can't plug Google's new Chromecast into it. To be honest, though, that's really not a big deal.All in all, this is a great TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: God-awful Audio.  I should have heeded the previous reviews.
Reviews.Author: J. Hubert
Reviews.Content: The video on this model is superior to the 2012 model (Toshiba 24SL410U), but the sound is atrocious.  A serious deal-breaker.  This unit goes back to Amazon tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: toshiba 24" 1080p led-lcd hdtv
Reviews.Author: thomas
Reviews.Content: The picture is great.  The speakers are totally misplaced and sound does not project forward.  Sound is short and "muffled".  Not happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: New TV's for the Camper
Reviews.Author: John Hauptstueck
Reviews.Content: We installed both in our new camper, now we have 3 in the unit. Perfect shape, no problems, easy installation.

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: brittany
Reviews.Content: I love this tv. It's smaller, but it's perfect for my husband and my room. We have never had a problem with it, works all the time. Only thing is I would like the cord to be a little longer so maybe we could put it more places in our room. But it has great picture quality and is an all around good tv for this price.

Reviews.Title: Flat Screen Sound Quality Poor
Reviews.Author: Daniel Dietz
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived quickly and was as described but the sound quality is very poor. I would not consider buying this unless it was intended for use with an external sound system.

Reviews.Title: The Toshiba TV has a very good price.
Reviews.Author: Jose A. Dominguez
Reviews.Content: This Toshiba TV has a good quality for the price is a very good buy.  The performance is great for a bedroom TV.

Reviews.Title: DOES NOT SUPPORT NETFLIX SUBTITLES
Reviews.Author: N. Sims
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this tv is you watch foreign movies or series (like "Girl With the Dragon Tattoo", or "The Protectors"). Toshiba does not support Netflix subtitles on most of their LED tvs as far as I can tell. My Sharp does, and both tv's stream from Roku boxes. Avoid Toshiba if you like to watch any of the great European shows on Netflix. Moreover, if you discover this problem after 30 days, you will be charged $35 dollars to be given this information.  Not the best tech support or customer service. Other LED brands have comparable pictures, better sound, and better customer service. Avoid this product.

Reviews.Title: It's just OK
Reviews.Author: Ken Wightman
Reviews.Content: The Picture is good but the sound quality is poor. I Probably would not buy it again because of that.

Reviews.Title: To Fix the Background Hum heard through the RCA output
Reviews.Author: Multuns
Reviews.Content: This information is for those who use the RCA Audio Outputs on the rear of this TV to feed an amplifier or receiver.  You may notice an insidious background hum when listening.  It is especially evident when listening with headphones.  To get rid of the hum, SET THE BACKLIGHT TO 100. That's all you have to do...the rest of the settings can be adjusted any way you please.  Yes, it's unfortunate...but it will eliminate the hum.  The Backlight can also be set to ZERO to eliminate the hum, but that's not very conducive to viewing.  Once you get the Backlight over 90, you will notice the hum start to fade.  You may even find yourself satisfied when leaving the backlight around 95.  100 eliminates it completely.  I hope this information helps you get more enjoyment out of the TV, as the picture is so sweet.

Reviews.Title: This TV is the best
Reviews.Author: yasm
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because I love theToshiba. Right out of the box, it was set up and then when plugged in turned on  and watched.  Now, that was easy and the price was easy, too,  on my budget.

Reviews.Title: not great as a computer monitor
Reviews.Author: fotoguy
Reviews.Content: Text was not easy to read, as if the contrast were too high resulting in ghosting around the letters. But I couldn't adjust the picture settings in any way that would make text look better, like it does on a dedicated monitor.As a tv, I thought the picture and sound were fine. [not sure what all the complaints about audio quality are about]

Reviews.Title: Great picture, bad interface
Reviews.Author: kylejpatrick
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as an open-box discounted united at a local retailer - it was missing the remote.  Seemed a small enough reason for me, for an almost 25% discount.  I basically wanted a TV for my spare bedroom for my playstation, or if any guest staying in that bedroom wanted to watch the TV.Overall I've been very pleased.  The resolution for my gaming experience, with HDMI cables, is fantastic.  If you're going to watch television though, I highly advise a digital converter for 1080p - without it it's pretty miserable.Initially I wanted to write a review about the sound - and it is deplorable.  It sounds canned, or something.  I would gladly buy a TV that's one inch deeper in size if it meant better sound speakers.  But since it seems like every other review here has been written about the sound, I thought I'd pick out one other inconvenience.  Since I didn't have a remote I had to rely on using the physical buttons on the front of the TV to change channels, switch to gaming mode, etc.  The buttons work almost like a touch screen - you don't depress the button but almost sort of swipe your thumbprint.  And that's a problem since the button areas are extremely faintly marked.  Now, 99% of you will probably be using a remote so it's no big deal, but I for one am constantly pressing the power button on this and my main TV.  And if something is used often enough to become an annoyance, it will be.But the benefits far outweigh the drawbacks.  Just might I suggest you try and get it for a discount rather than full retail.  And if you will be using this in any other place than spare bedroom or kitchen, invest in some small surround sound speakers.  Happy viewing.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture, horrible sound
Reviews.Author: Xbox gamers = REAL GAMERS unlike the sonymite...
Reviews.Content: Beautiful 2D quality, the only downside is horrible sound. I suggest putting it in a small room or buying a cheap surround sound system 3/5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!  Perfect for my bachelor bedroom!
Reviews.Author: KTM32688
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a nice quality picture t.v and I am very pleased with this one.  Set up in a half hour, so simple to program and love the features for HD and picture sizes...Sits on my dresser and is the perfect fit.  I keep the sound on volume 1 and it's still loud enough to hear in the next room.  This is my first flatscreen and Im planning on having it for a long time.  I still have not bought the high def cable for it yet, but the picture is so much better than my old square tube t.v.

Reviews.Title: '...Shiba Baby!"
Reviews.Author: Ronji
Reviews.Content: Outstanding flat screen TV which is used in the den.  Excellent reception and picture and does not require a cable box/adapter to pick up channels.  Tastefully matches the decor of the room as well.

Reviews.Title: The sound make my ear hurt...
Reviews.Author: Alice M "Alice M"
Reviews.Content: I am still looking for a solution for the sound. The sound is really terrible. It make my ear hurt. The picture is great. If I can not find a solution, I have to return it.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Fu Jinhai
Reviews.Content: I use it as the second monitor of my laptop. Fantastic. The display is excellent. And the speakers are not that bad, though not to be rated as good. I have a separate speaker system, so I don't care what the TV speakers are. I would highly recommend this product. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: beatlemania705
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic tv with amazing picture quality. This tv though, does have terrible speakers, but you can use some other speakers, or you'll get use to it.I bought this Tv mainly for gaming, and it does a perfect job. No lag, and there's also a gaming mode. Don't not buy this tv due to the fact that it has terrible speakers, because the picture quality is top notch.

Reviews.Title: TOSHIBA 24" GOOD TV!
Reviews.Author: The Old Teacher "Dan"
Reviews.Content: Toshiba has been a consistently good product.  Now, don't get me wrong.  My Bravia is still a better TV, but, for the price, and for what we needed, this is a good set.  For those who have hearing difficulties, this product, unlike most, offers an audio-out that works with the more modern hearing aids, so that the person using the hearing aids can hear the TV through them and not affect the overall sound level for others in the room.  It's a really good set for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, lousy sound
Reviews.Author: Chip E
Reviews.Content: We got this TV for my wife to watch the news in the kitchen and for me to carry to another room occasionally as an HD monitor. It's light enough to move around easily. The picture is excellent for both TV and monitor. The sound, as noted by many others, is lousy; but neither of us minds.  If it we were going to use it for anything else, the sound would be a problem.

Reviews.Title: Good Choice
Reviews.Author: John C. Mulliken "considered opinion"
Reviews.Content: Ideal for my small "office." The color is impressive, as is the clarity. All I can hop for is that the set lasts as long as my old Hitachi.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, Bad Very Sound
Reviews.Author: C. Fuentes
Reviews.Content: Low sound volume seems to be a big problem with these small TV's.  I love the picture, but it hard to enjoy it with such poor sound.  I had to get a iLive ITP100B Two Channel Bar Speaker System 19" to see if this takes care of the problem.  I hate having to buy a sound bar, but it may be one way to fix it.  I have not received the sound bar yet, so I'll have to update my review after I get it.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Toshiba for Christmas
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL STEPHENS "msjams42"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my mother who has some issues with eyesight now-it is her 1st HDTV and was astonished at how bright and crystal clear the screen is-it has totally improved her viewing pleasure-she can read everything on the screen now and loves watching football now.Someone wrote earlier about sound being somewhat tinny-I see what they mean however I was planning on getting a speaker bar if needed. She only listens to the volume on 4 amazingly enough-if you put the volume up to what people without bat ears do the sound is fine.Maybe from a surround sound perspective sound is off-but normal television watching and movie viewing;I could not be more pleased with my purchase-Give it a try you wont be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: Lovin it
Reviews.Author: Happy Customer
Reviews.Content: It arrived promptly. I was happy with the screen size brightness and clarity of the picture. The weight is very light an its easy to connect and use. Very happy with the tv over all.

Reviews.Title: BAD SOUND AND MARVELOUS IMAGE
Reviews.Author: Luis Gabelman "Luisca"
Reviews.Content: I'm agree with most of people writing about its precious image but ist awful sound.You need to put it in a loud mode to hear it "normal". I'm confidence about Toshiba quality, but they could do a better job with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Best-in-Class Picture, Worst-in-Universe Sound
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: My god, this TV. I didn't even think you could get speakers this bad, much less in a TV costing this much. Anyone who says they had no problems with the sound is either functionally deaf and lying, or has never used their ears before. I have $7 earbuds that sound better than this TV.The worst part is, the picture quality on this TV is staggering. Even when watching standard definition programming(BBC on Comcast, anyone?), the picture is amazingly clear and noise-free. Add to that a wide range of inputs and it seemed like the perfect TV for my home office.But the audio! I even tried updating the firmware, but it just updated it to the same version number, and the sound isn't any better at all. I'm taking this television back to the store I bought it as soon as I can, but do yourself a favor and find a different model for yourself.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 24SL410u TV --HORRIBLE SOUND
Reviews.Author: Broadway Collector
Reviews.Content: We know better than to buy without going to CNET to read reviews.  But, it's Christmas, we were in a rush.  Serves us right.We brought it home, hooked it up, and the sound is the absolute WORST. Laughable. TINNY and muted. Just horrible, awful sound.  How can any company can be proud of this product?  We are returning it immediately, and we will be avoiding Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba review
Reviews.Author: Cheetah
Reviews.Content: I was VERY disappointed in the sound.  It is like listening thru a tin can.  I would like to return this item, but there were no return instructions that came with the product.  The picture is fine but the sound makes me cringe.I would not recommend this Toshiba T.V.

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected
Reviews.Author: jayne norman
Reviews.Content: Since I requested built-in dvd only - the way you offered this was misleading.  Cost me 30 bucks in returns for nothing.

Reviews.Title: We love it
Reviews.Author: susannatalya
Reviews.Content: We love it.  Great color!  Does a lot of things we don't understand how to set up.  Has all this tech stuff gone past the 100th monkey point?  Is this enough words?Is this enough words?Is this enough words?Is this enough words?Is this enough words?

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 24 inch Television
Reviews.Author: M. Sanchez "Sam's Gram"
Reviews.Content: I bought this television for a guest bedroom and we are quite happy with it.  I didn't want to spend too much money or get too small a t.v.  This one fit both criteria and I got it at a great price, free shipping and no taxes.  Who can ask for more?  As you can tell I am not a connoseur of technology...this t.v. comes on when you press the right button, has great color, and catches all the channels.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 24 inch t.v.
Reviews.Author: Claudine
Reviews.Content: I needed to find a dependable t.v. for my disabled sister who lives alone...I live in the UK she in USA. In the end Amazon had the best price and respecgtable delivery  So far so good...t.v. is lovely and she is enjoying it.  Once again Amazon had the better product and the more economical price.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 24SL410U 24-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED-LCD HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: Linda Makofski "Linda A. Makofski"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Toshiba 24SL410U 24-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED-LCD HDTV, Black  as a gift and the recipient was thrilled with it.

Reviews.Title: Best Damn Deal On Amazon
Reviews.Author: Bill Sisk "Mr Bill"
Reviews.Content: This Toshiba is undoubtably the best buy on the internet money and quality wise. Pic is great and its 1080i HD w/ 2 hdmi ports. It is light wght@ 8.6# and that means 30# hanger is over adaquate and dont cost arm and leg! $20 on Amazon! Bought it because I have DirecTV and use it in the bedroom, move to Poolroom, use it in workshop and it fits great in motorhome! Modified 2 brkts for quik change and fabbed 2 more at a cost of $49 total. Thats a total of $250 for a 4 room setup of Hi-Def TV! Damn! Damn! I am good!! BUT AMAZON IS BETTER!!!  billhttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004MFBH7O/ref=cm_cr_rev_prod_titleps: I did have a few cash points, but those were free too!!  lololol!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 24sl410u lcd tv
Reviews.Author: RetiredGuy
Reviews.Content: Originally got a kindle fire as a birthday gift but couldn't use it. So I brought it back to Best Buy and traded it in for this tv and a rabbit ear antenna (about $15) plus about $40. I don't have cable tv. The tv was put in my bedroom on the second floor and works very well, both picture and sound.The reason why I'm giving it a 4 instead of a 5 rating is that there was a smell to it when first used. I assume that this might be common to most new tvs but I'm not sure. After a few weeks there is only a slight trace of that "burn in" smell.Yes, I would recommend this tv to someone who doesn't have a lot of room for a tv, especially in their bedroom..

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 24SL410U
Reviews.Author: Fletcher Hanks "Fletch"
Reviews.Content: This TV accepts my computer for playing downloaded videos from youtube like "Zeitgeist - The Federal Reserve". The videos are clear and the sound is deep and pure! I like the picture choices. Haven't found out how to lock the picture display - must adjust every picture, which isn't difficult, however I watch all the channels in the same mode, but must adjust each as I switch to different channels. Too bad! At $7/year to run WOW it is sweet!

Reviews.Title: Not From Office Max  from Amazon?
Reviews.Author: Gary B. Stanley "fire virgin"
Reviews.Content: I just came from OM after going to pick up this TV.  The salesman knew nothing except I should buy a warranty.  My AMEX doubles my warranty.  I said SOUND was important to me.I left with the TV sitting at the register when he HIT WITH THE BIG ONE.  A 15% RESTOCKING fee if I would like to return it.  Laugh a Minute huh?  Why would I buy anything with a 15% restocking fee?

Reviews.Title: Good for a secondary tv
Reviews.Author: VD
Reviews.Content: I use this TV in my kitchen and it is perfect for that.  It's cheap, light so it was easy to mount, picture is very good, and the sound is fine.  I wouldn't be watching Jurassic Park on it or anything, but it is great for use in the kitchen or garage.

Reviews.Title: Just what we wanted
Reviews.Author: Bigdog
Reviews.Content: A great tv right out of the box.  Just what we wanted for the bedroom at our cabin!!!  Nobody could match the price.

Reviews.Title: Bad product and even worse service
Reviews.Author: Corey "ctrues"
Reviews.Content: My 40" Toshiba had the main board go bad after only 2 years. Customer service was completely useless and derogatory with me. The repair estimate was more than a new TV. Do yourself a favor and buy another brand.
